title: Boris Johnson and the Jennifer Arcuri allegations – podcast
text:
Boris Johnson says he behaved with ‘full propriety’ regarding his links to the US businesswoman Jennifer Arcuri while he was London mayor. Matthew Weaver has been following the story for the Guardian. Plus: Wadah Khanfar remembers his friend Jamal Khashoggi on the anniversary of his murder

Boris Johnson’s friendship while he was London mayor with the American tech entrepreneur Jennifer Arcuri has come under fierce scrutiny after questions emerged over £126,000 of public money being awarded to her companies.

The Guardian’s Matthew Weaver has been following the story for the Guardian as Johnson continues to state he has “no interest to declare”. The Greater London Authority wrote to Johnson on Friday noting claims that he had on more than one occasion used his position as mayor to benefit and reward Arcuri, saying it had referred the matter to the police watchdog.

Meanwhile, in Manchester today the prime minister will attempt to cut through the deepening allegations with his keynote conference speech.

Also today: Wadah Khanfar remembers his friend Jamal Khashoggi on the anniversary of his death.
